attributes.action: Provide specific advice and support for Year 12 students during the pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: Year 12 students are at a crucial point in their education, studying for A-Level exams which will determine their futures. Yet, Year 12 have not been given the same level of guidance and certainty as Year 11 and 13 students, and have been completely left out of government schemes such as the Oak National Academy. Students are struggling to study for life-changing exams where, in many cases, online resources are not adequate. The government must act to support Year 12 during this crucial time.
attributes.background: We want the Government to provide specific guidance to Year 12 students, and how their education and progression to higher education/apprenticeships will be impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. There is also a need for government-approved online resources which support the A-Level curriculum.

rejection.details:
The Governemnt is not directly responsible for teaching arrangements for year 12 students, or progression to higher education, as these are a matter for individual schools, universities, and UCAS.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to signs:

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

Prioritise Years 10 and 12 when re-opening schools after the COVID-19 Lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320531

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
